Based on JC Lee's play of the same name. (Repeat).

programme.title: A Thin Line Between Love and Hate
programme.desc: An ambitious nightclub promoter discovers that the woman he tried so hard to get is even harder to get rid of when their casual romance turns deadly serious. Directed by Martin Lawrence. Kris Kristofferson, Barbara Hershey, Leelee Sobieski, Jane Birkin, Dominique Blanc, Jesse Bradford, James Ivory. (Repeat).

programme.title: This One's For The Ladies
programme.desc: This documentary explores the sexual and social identity of contemporary black America through intimate, eye opening and often hilarious accounts from women and men who find love and community in the underground world of exotic dancing. (Repeat).

programme.title: Get Rich Or Die Tryin'
programme.desc: Saga of a street kid turned drug dealer turned rap artist, loosely based on the life of hip-hop star Calvin "50 Cent" Jackson, who basically plays himself. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Warriors
programme.desc: A Coney Island gang known as the Warriors goes to the Bronx to attend a city-wide meeting of all gangs; at that event, however, the psychotic leader of a rival outfit, the Rogues, assassinates the head of the city's foremost gang, but the Warriors are pegged as culpable, and they must fight their way across rival turf to make it safely back to their territory. (Repeat).

programme.title: Imagine That
programme.desc: This winning family film stars Eddie Murphy as an ambitious financial whiz who sacrifices time with his 7-year-old daughter (Yara Shahidi) for the sake of his job. One day his daughter's imaginary world unexpectedly helps his career, prompting him to improve their strained relationship. Directed by Karey Kirkpatrick. Thomas Haden Church, Ronny Cox, Martin Sheen. (Repeat).

programme.title: Warrior Strong
programme.desc: To save the career he endangered with his hotheaded attitude, professional basketball player Bilal Irving takes on a new job - coaching the failing basketball team in his hometown of Dumont, Ontario. He's got just one obstacle: his former coach, whose ideas about coaching vastly differ from that of Bilal's. The two will have to put aside their differences and their attitudes if this small-town team is to have any chance at winning. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Cookout
programme.desc: A fine cast cooks up funny performances in this hilarious urban comedy. When a basketball player (Storm P) signs a $30 million contract, he invites friends and family from the 'hood to a cookout at his estate. But the barbecue doesn't go as planned, as the rich sports star deals with gold diggers, agents, stuffy neighbors and a wacky security guard (writer-producer Queen Latifah). Tim Meadows, Danny Glover, Farrah Fawcett, Ja Rule. (Repeat).

programme.title: Scary Movie
programme.desc: The Wayans brothers (stars Marlon and Shawn and director Keenen Ivory) will make you howl with laughter as they slash teen horror movies in this raunchy spoof. After covering up a fatal accident, clueless teens are murdered by a bumbling serial killer. Anna Faris, Shannon Elizabeth, Lochlyn Munro. (Repeat).

programme.title: Scary Movie 2
programme.desc: A raunchy spoof of horror flicks, this sequel to the 2000 box-office hit follows a group of students that is drawn to a haunted house by a demented professor who wants to perform sleep-deprivation experiments on them. (Repeat).

programme.title: Scary Movie 3
programme.desc: David Zucker, the man behind "Airplane!" directed this inspired spoof of horror movies with nods to "Signs," "The Ring," "The Matrix Reloaded" and even "8 Mile." (Repeat).

programme.title: Harlem Nights
programme.desc: In the 1930s two gambling-house proprietors fend off gangster Bugsy Calhoune from muscling into their operation. (Repeat).

programme.title: Scary Movie
programme.desc: The Wayans brothers (stars Marlon and Shawn and director Keenen Ivory) will make you howl with laughter as they slash teen horror movies in this raunchy spoof. After covering up a fatal accident, clueless teens are murdered by a bumbling serial killer. Anna Faris, Shannon Elizabeth, Lochlyn Munro. (Repeat).

programme.title: Scary Movie 2
programme.desc: A raunchy spoof of horror flicks, this sequel to the 2000 box-office hit follows a group of students that is drawn to a haunted house by a demented professor who wants to perform sleep-deprivation experiments on them. (Repeat).

programme.title: Scary Movie 3
programme.desc: David Zucker, the man behind "Airplane!" directed this inspired spoof of horror movies with nods to "Signs," "The Ring," "The Matrix Reloaded" and even "8 Mile." (Repeat).

programme.title: Hustle & Flow
programme.desc: A Memphis pimp and pusher tries to redeem himself by becoming a rapper. (Repeat).

programme.title: Fresh
programme.desc: Cautionary tale about inner-city hopelessness, focusing on a 12-year-old drug carrier and his struggle for survival on Brooklyn streets. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Longest Yard
programme.desc: A warden/football fan tags a new convict, an ex-pro QB, to choose a team from among his inmates to play against the well-trained prison guards. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Aggressives
programme.desc: This acclaimed documentary -- made by one of the fashion worlds most sought after casting directors -- picks up where Paris is Burning left off, focusing on a group of six NYC lesbians who dress and identify as men, blurring the lines between butch dyke and trans-male identities. For our guest host, writer-artist-performer and member of NY's own House of Ladosha, Juliana Huxtable, the film explores "the complexities of how desire is negotiated between the multitude of gender types in the ballroo (Repeat).

programme.title: Stand
programme.desc: A raw and unflinching examination of the courageous and remarkable life of basketball star and social justice activist Mahmoud Abdul-Rauf. (Repeat).

programme.title: All Up in the Biz
programme.desc: Acclaimed director Sacha Jenkins shines a spotlight on the life and rhymes of the 'clown prince of hip-hop', Biz Markie, best known for his Top 40 hit, "Just a Friend." A who's who of legends like rappers Rakim, Big Daddy Kane, Doug E Fresh and actor/comedian Tracy Morgan share how Markie's playful approach to the genre made him a hip-hop icon and left an indelible mark in the world of music. (Repeat).

programme.title: Spotlights: A Showtime Short Film Series
programme.desc: A teenage girl learns a secret while visiting her family in Jamaica. (Repeat).

programme.title: Breathe
programme.desc: In a dystopian future of oxygen scarcity, Maya and her daughter Zora cling to survival underground. Their fragile existence is upended by the arrival of a couple claiming ties to Maya's presumed dead husband. As secrets unravel, mother and daughter must confront the true nature of their visitors to survive. (Repeat).

programme.title: Parallel
programme.desc: While grappling with her seemingly insurmountable grief, a young woman named Vanessa embarks on a retreat in search of some solace. However, she soon discovers that the lines between different realities have begun to blur, and she finds herself caught in the crossfire. (Repeat).

programme.title: Beverly Hills Cop III
programme.desc: A wiseacre cop from Detroit finds himself in L.A. trailing killers and counterfeiters at an amusement park. (Repeat).

programme.title: Set It Off
programme.desc: Desperate for a financial solution to their troubles, four alienated girlfriends plan a series of bank heists, growing more daring and reckless with each success. Jada Pinkett, Queen Latifah, Vivica A. Fox, Kimberly Elise, John C. McGinley, Blair Underwood, Anne Marie Horsford, Ella Joyce, Charlie Robinson, Chaz Lamar Shepard. (Repeat).

programme.title: Heist 88
programme.desc: A criminal mastermind recruits a group of young bank employees to steal 80 million dollars in one of the largest bank heist in US history. (Repeat).

programme.title: Out of Darkness
programme.desc: Six adventurers arrive on an ancient shore seeking refuge. Soon, their dreams dissolve into dread when they encounter a malevolent force. Amidst fracturing bonds, a courageous young woman confronts the unsettling truth that survival demands unspeakable choices against an enigmatic and menacing adversary, forcing them to navigate the darkest corners of their humanity to endure. (Repeat).

programme.title: Breathe
programme.desc: In a dystopian future of oxygen scarcity, Maya and her daughter Zora cling to survival underground. Their fragile existence is upended by the arrival of a couple claiming ties to Maya's presumed dead husband. As secrets unravel, mother and daughter must confront the true nature of their visitors to survive. (Repeat).

programme.title: Parallel
programme.desc: While grappling with her seemingly insurmountable grief, a young woman named Vanessa embarks on a retreat in search of some solace. However, she soon discovers that the lines between different realities have begun to blur, and she finds herself caught in the crossfire. (Repeat).

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: The lives of four Harlem friends, one of whom is an aspiring deejay, fall apart following their involvement in a holdup gone fatally wrong. (Repeat).

programme.title: B. A.
programme.desc: A gang initiation goes wrong when a group of four recruits break into a house of horror. Win and you live - lose and you die. Sheaun McKinney, Tunde Laleye. (Repeat).

programme.title: Lavell Crawford: Thee Lavell Crawford
programme.desc: Live from New Orleans, Lavell Crawford is back with a new comedy special, riffing on everything from white neighborhoods to getting blessed with impossibly good deals on chicken and so much more. (Repeat).

programme.title: All Styles
programme.desc: A young hip-hop artist has a falling out with his dance crew over his decision to go to college before a big competition. (Repeat).

programme.title: Hands Up
programme.desc: After his cousin is shot and killed by a white police officer in Chicago and Black Lives Matter protests spread across the city, a black inner city teen desperately fights for a way out of the most notorious murder capital of America. (Repeat).

programme.title: S.O.G.: The Book of Ward
programme.desc: Andre Ward's journey from the streets of Oakland to the International Boxing Hall of Fame. Facing an all-too familiar series of obstacles including substance abuse, the loss of a parent, drug dealing and teen pregnancy, how Ward faced that adversity is what separates him from the rest. Fight after fight he defied the odds and silenced his critics. And then, guided by faith and devotion, he walked away, choosing his role as a father and a husband over his boxing career. (Repeat).

programme.title: Nana's Boys
programme.desc: Nana's Boys focuses on the intimate life of a couple who are confronted with the fact that their relationship is not as solid as they thought. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Longest Yard
programme.desc: A warden/football fan tags a new convict, an ex-pro QB, to choose a team from among his inmates to play against the well-trained prison guards. (Repeat).

programme.title: When We Were Kings
programme.desc: Leon Gast's Oscar-winning portrait of Muhammad Ali, filmed in 1974 during the buildup to his highly publicized fight with George Foreman in Zaire. Narrated by Spike Lee, Norman Mailer and George Plimpton. (Repeat).

programme.title: Hoop Dreams
programme.desc: Inspirational documentary that follows two high-school basketball players over four years as they set their sights on college scholarships and a chance to play in the NBA. (Repeat).

programme.title: MVP
programme.desc: On the streets of Hollywood, a recently retired NFL player is saved from scandal by a homeless veteran. With their "glory days" behind them, the two men bond in search of purpose and identity. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Longest Yard
programme.desc: A warden/football fan tags a new convict, an ex-pro QB, to choose a team from among his inmates to play against the well-trained prison guards. (Repeat).

programme.title: Mr. Brooks
programme.desc: A police detective who lost the trail of a serial killer years earlier begins to suspect a successful and prominent businessman is the perpetrator. (Repeat).

programme.title: Kobe Bryant's Muse
programme.desc: An in-depth look at the on and off-court life of the 16-time NBA All-Star, who has helped the Lakers win five championships. Included: the mentors, allies and rivalries that have shaped his career, and his thoughts on what lies ahead. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Longest Yard
programme.desc: A warden/football fan tags a new convict, an ex-pro QB, to choose a team from among his inmates to play against the well-trained prison guards. (Repeat).

programme.title: Michael Clayton
programme.desc: George Clooney is superb in this intelligent and complex character study of a burned-out "fixer" at a powerful corporate law firm in New York City who faces a crisis of conscience as he comes to grips with his amoral actions. Written and directed by Tony Gilroy. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Infiltrator
programme.desc: In this incredible crime drama based on true events, federal agent Robert Mazur goes undercover as a money-laundering businessman in an attempt to bring down Pablo Escobar's Medellín Cartel in the 1980s. (Repeat).

programme.title: Faster
programme.desc: In this heart-pounding action thriller, Driver (Dwayne Johnson) seeks revenge on the man responsible for his brother's death, but a devoted cop gets wind of his plan and tries to stop him from carrying it out. Meanwhile, a hit man attempts to end Driver's life before he completes his task. (Repeat).

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: Dynamic Samuel L. Jackson stars as New York City cop John Shaft, who quits the force and decides to dispense his own brand of vigilante justice against a racist killer (Christian Bale) and a Dominican drug lord (Jeffrey Wright). Richard Roundtree, who played the original John Shaft in three '70s crime dramas, has a cameo as Jackson's uncle and namesake. Busta Rhymes, Vanessa Williams, Dan Hedaya. (Repeat).

programme.title: Looper
programme.desc: Time travel and the mob send a hired gun on the run when he must kill an older version of himself in order to prevent an underworld bloodbath in this smart and inventive sci-fi actioner. (Repeat).

programme.title: Gladiator
programme.desc: Thrilling action and Russell Crowe's Oscar-winning performance drive 2000's Best Picture, the story of a Roman general who is enslaved and forced to become a gladiator after he clashes with the emperor's bloodthirsty son. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Wolf of Wall Street
programme.desc: An ambitious young stockbroker begins a new firm and finds meteoric success by selling penny stocks to the super wealthy. He amasses a fortune through less than legal means, and soon his law-breaking and massive drug habit collapse his empire. (Repeat).

programme.title: Zack and Miri Make a Porno
programme.desc: Writer-director Kevin Smith deftly blends sweet romance with crude, lewd inspired lunacy in this outrageously funny comedy. Seth Rogen and Elizabeth Banks play cash-strapped platonic roommates who try to make it in the adult-movie business in an attempt to get out of debt. A superb ensemble cast of costars features Craig Robinson, Jason Mewes, Justin Long, Ricky Mabe and Jeff Anderson. Former adult-film performers Traci Lords and Katie Morgan also have roles. (Repeat).

programme.title: Private Parts
programme.desc: Tracing the turbulent career of radio and TV shock-jock Howard Stern, including his experiences as a struggling kid, his first attempts at spicing up his talk show, his married life and his rise to fame at New York's WNBC. Robin Quivers, Fred Norris, Mary McCormack, Gary Dell' Abate, Jackie Martling. (Repeat).

programme.title: Arena Wars
programme.desc: In 2045 convicted criminals are given the opportunity to compete on the world's #1 televised sporting event, Arena Wars. They must survive 7 rooms and 7 of the most vicious killers in the country. If they win, they regain their freedom. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Infiltrator
programme.desc: In this incredible crime drama based on true events, federal agent Robert Mazur goes undercover as a money-laundering businessman in an attempt to bring down Pablo Escobar's Medellín Cartel in the 1980s. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Running Man
programme.desc: A cop in 2019 America is framed for massacring rioting civilians during a famine. After escaping from jail he tries to prove his innocence, but is captured along with an innocent civilian, and they are forced to participate in a violent game show called "The Running Man." (Repeat).

programme.title: The Peacemaker
programme.desc: A headstrong military man and a scientist go on a frantic search for stolen nuclear warheads before they fall into the wrong hands in this explosive action thriller. (Repeat).

programme.title: True Grit
programme.desc: In the Coen brothers' stirring remake of the John Wayne classic, an alcoholic U.S. Marshal and an independent-minded 14-year-old girl track down her father's killer with the help of a Texas Ranger. As the three brave dangerous Indian territory, they discover their prey has fallen in with a more-experienced criminal. (Repeat).

programme.title: Beverly Hills Cop
programme.desc: A crack Detroit detective pursues a pal's killer through the plastic jungle of Southern California, where he tweaks authority, tumbles with the bad guys and bends the rules. (Repeat).

programme.title: Beverly Hills Cop II
programme.desc: Eddie Murphy returns as smooth Detroit street cop Axel Foley, who's back on the West Coast to track down a gunman and investigate a series of violent robberies. John Ashton, Ronny Cox and Judge Reinhold reprise their roles. (Repeat).

programme.title: Beverly Hills Cop III
programme.desc: A wiseacre cop from Detroit finds himself in L.A. trailing killers and counterfeiters at an amusement park. (Repeat).

programme.title: Unforgiven
programme.desc: In this thrilling and provocative revisionist Western, a former gunslinger-turned-farmer agrees to help hunt down two cowboys who assaulted and disfigured a prostitute. However, his quest brings him into conflict with an authoritarian sheriff. (Repeat).

programme.title: Saving Private Ryan
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg won the Best Director Oscar for this stunning war drama following a squad of U.S. Army soldiers on a mission to rescue a GI trapped behind enemy lines in France on D-Day after all three of the soldier's brothers are killed in action. As the search commences, the close-knit squad sets out through areas still thick with Nazis. (Repeat).

programme.title: True Grit
programme.desc: In the Coen brothers' stirring remake of the John Wayne classic, an alcoholic U.S. Marshal and an independent-minded 14-year-old girl track down her father's killer with the help of a Texas Ranger. As the three brave dangerous Indian territory, they discover their prey has fallen in with a more-experienced criminal. (Repeat).

programme.title: Wolves of War
programme.desc: Decorated British officer Jack Wallace must lead a band of Allied commandos across enemy lines to rescue Professor Hopper, an American scientist held hostage by the Nazis. With information that could turn the tide of war, these unlikely heroes must traverse enemy territory with an untrained US civilian, avoiding brutal Nazi mercenaries and non-stop bombing – with the fate of the war resting on their shoulders, the outcome of this mission will change the world forever; failure is not an option. (Repeat).

programme.title: Cold in July
programme.desc: In this riveting thriller, a Texas man shoots and kills a home intruder, and is subsequently targeted for revenge by the victim's father. Meanwhile, the unusual behavior exhibited by the investigating police detectives indicates that something is amiss. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Peacemaker
programme.desc: A headstrong military man and a scientist go on a frantic search for stolen nuclear warheads before they fall into the wrong hands in this explosive action thriller. (Repeat).

programme.title: Vantage Point
programme.desc: In this riveting thriller, an assassination attempt is made on the president in front of a crowd, but no two witnesses can agree on who did what to whom. A Secret Service agent (Dennis Quaid) must race against time to uncover the shocking truth before the conspirators escape. Matthew Fox, Sigourney Weaver, Forest Whitaker, William Hurt. (Repeat).

programme.title: Insomnia
programme.desc: Christopher Nolan, of "Memento" fame, directed this taut and atmospheric crime thriller, a remake of a 1997 Norwegian film. Al Pacino is in top form as L.A. detective Will Dormer, who travels to a remote Alaska town to investigate a murder. Unable to sleep, the weary Dormer is drawn into an intense cat-and-mouse game with the sly and taunting killer. Robin Williams, Hilary Swank. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Conversation
programme.desc: Character study of Harry Caul, an expert wiretapper assigned to surveil a couple in San Francisco. As he learns more about the couple through conversation, Harry wrestles with the notion that his recording could lead to their murder. (Repeat).

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: Gripping and ripping remake of the 1957 Western about a small-time rancher (Christian Bale) escorting a murderous outlaw (Russell Crowe) to a rendezvous with the law and a train that will take him to prison. Meanwhile, the desperado's henchmen try to head them off and free their leader, because without him they're "like a pack of dogs without a master." Directed by James Mangold, from a 1953 short story by Elmore Leonard. Ben Foster, Gretchen Mol, Dallas Roberts, Alan Tudyk, Peter Fonda. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Yards
programme.desc: After serving time for a crime he didn't commit, Leo Handler makes an effort to get his life back on track. Joining the family business, he unknowingly enters into a world of danger and lawlessness and must decide whether to speak up or remain silent. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Contractor
programme.desc: Ex-Marine James Harper takes up arms in a paramilitary unit after his involuntary discharge from the Special Forces leaves him scrambling to make ends meet for his family. On a covert mission abroad, Harper soon finds himself caught in a violent feud, forcing him to find a way home by any means necessary. (Repeat).

programme.title: Primal Fear
programme.desc: Richard Gere and Oscar nominee Edward Norton star in this intense courtroom drama. Gere plays slick lawyer Martin Vail, who agrees to defend a guileless 19-year-old (Norton) who has been accused in the brutal murder of the Archbishop of Chicago. Though Vail sees the case as a way to gain publicity, the revelations in the case begin to chill him. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Gift
programme.desc: In this nail-biting chiller, Simon and Robyn, a young married couple, find their lives thrown into a tailspin after Simon has a chance encounter with a former acquaintance, the off-kilter Gordo. Gordo then starts giving the couple unwanted and increasingly menacing gifts. (Repeat).

programme.title: Mr. Brooks
programme.desc: A police detective who lost the trail of a serial killer years earlier begins to suspect a successful and prominent businessman is the perpetrator. (Repeat).

programme.title: Chloe
programme.desc: In this erotically charged drama, Catherine (Julianne Moore) suspects her husband David (Liam Neeson) may be cheating on her, so she hires a prostitute named Chloe (Amanda Seyfried) to flirt with him and report back to her about how he responds. However, Catherine eventually finds herself drawn to Chloe and the stories she shares of her erotic encounters with David. (Repeat).

programme.title: Tale of Tales
programme.desc: In this sublime adaptation of three 17th-century Italian fairy tales about troubled royals, a queen conceives a child by eating a monster's heart, a king grows obsessed with a pet flea and a ruler is bewitched by a woman with a beautiful singing voice. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Gift
programme.desc: In this nail-biting chiller, Simon and Robyn, a young married couple, find their lives thrown into a tailspin after Simon has a chance encounter with a former acquaintance, the off-kilter Gordo. Gordo then starts giving the couple unwanted and increasingly menacing gifts. (Repeat).

programme.title: Singularity
programme.desc: In 2020, a supercomputer determines that human beings pose the greatest threat to Earth, and begins an eradication process. Decades later, a teen struggles to survive in a world dominated by machines in this haunting sci-fi thriller. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Last Voyage of the Demeter
programme.desc: In the late nineteenth century, the Russian schooner Demeter embarks on an unusual quest, carrying twenty-four unmarked crates from Carpathia to London. Their voyage seems doomed from the start, given their suspicious orders, as a malevolent presence preys upon each member of the crew. When the ship arrives, at last, in Whitby Harbour, the crew is nowhere to be found. The story is based on a chapter from Bram Stoker's Dracula. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Dead Zone
programme.desc: A teacher awakens from a five-year coma with supernatural powers. He struggles with his new gift and attempts to use it for good while coming to terms with the life he has missed out on. Based on the novel by Stephen King. (Repeat).

programme.title: Tremors
programme.desc: Men living in a small desert community come upon some inexplicable phenomena, including at least one very grisly body. It turns out that there are gigantic wormlike carnivores living under the desert that come up to feed on humans. (Repeat).

programme.title: Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street
programme.desc: Best Actor Oscar nominee Johnny Depp perfectly embodies the title role in Tim Burton's bloody well-done adaptation of the Stephen Sondheim musical about the vengeful owner of a tonsorial parlor that offers customers more than just a shave and a haircut. Helena Bonham Carter costars as Mrs. Lovett, who makes a killing with her new pie recipe containing a special meaty ingredient. (Repeat).

programme.title: Talk To Me
programme.desc: A group of friends plays a dangerous game against the spirit world. After stumbling on an embalmed hand, the group figures out how to use it to conjure spirits. Consumed by this thrilling new power to communicate with the dead, they unlock the spirit world and must face the deadly consequences. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Faculty
programme.desc: High schoolers face an onslaught of aliens who have taken over the bodies of their teachers. (Repeat).

programme.title: Child's Play
programme.desc: When a murderer is killed in a police shoot-out, he invokes a voodoo spell that allows him to transfer his spirit into a doll. (Repeat).

programme.title: Good Will Hunting
programme.desc: Costars and co-writers Matt Damon and Ben Affleck won an Oscar for their tale of a charismatic genius (Damon) who lands in jail after a playground brawl. His hope for the future lies with a sympathetic therapist (Best Supporting Actor Robin Williams), who understands the young man's rebellious nature. Minnie Driver, Stellan Skarsgard, Casey Affleck. (Repeat).

programme.title: Private Parts
programme.desc: Tracing the turbulent career of radio and TV shock-jock Howard Stern, including his experiences as a struggling kid, his first attempts at spicing up his talk show, his married life and his rise to fame at New York's WNBC. Robin Quivers, Fred Norris, Mary McCormack, Gary Dell' Abate, Jackie Martling. (Repeat).

programme.title: Forrest Gump
programme.desc: Six Oscars, including Best Picture and Actor (Tom Hanks), went to this extraordinary tale of a simple man who unwittingly becomes involved in some of the key moments of the 20th century. Meanwhile, as the remarkable parade of his life goes by, Forrest never forgets Jenny, the girl he loved as a boy, who makes her own journey through the turbulence of the 1960s and '70s that is far more troubled than the path Forrest happens upon. (Repeat).

programme.title: Vantage Point
programme.desc: In this riveting thriller, an assassination attempt is made on the president in front of a crowd, but no two witnesses can agree on who did what to whom. A Secret Service agent (Dennis Quaid) must race against time to uncover the shocking truth before the conspirators escape. Matthew Fox, Sigourney Weaver, Forest Whitaker, William Hurt. (Repeat).

programme.title: Noah
programme.desc: Noah receives a warning from God about a great flood, and constructs an ark to save creation as the planet is cleansed of sin in this stunning Biblical epic. Later, Noah and his family are forced to defend their massive vessel from malicious invaders. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Social Network
programme.desc: In this sweeping tale of Internet success, nerdy, awkward Harvard student Mark Zuckerberg creates the Web site Facebook and becomes a billionaire, but ends up embroiled in legal disputes as the friends who helped him during his rise to the top are now eager to see him fall. (Repeat).

programme.title: Bad Behaviour
programme.desc: When a former child actor tries to reconnect with her daughter, she is led to a spiritual enlightenment retreat. Their relationship is very complicated, and they put all of their trust in a guru and experimental ideas to try and bring them back together. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Dead Don't Hurt
programme.desc: In the 1860s western frontier, the fiercely independent Vivienne Le Coudy joins her lover Holger Olsen in Elk Flats, Nevada. But the Civil War tears them apart, leaving Vivienne to fight corrupt Mayor Schiller and his ruthless partner. When Holger returns, they must confront their changed selves amidst a landscape of love, betrayal, and the struggle for justice. (Repeat).

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: Luke Wilson, Vince Vaughn and Will Ferrell star in this raucous comedy reminiscent of "Animal House." They play three disillusioned men who decide to start a fraternity near their old college in an effort to recapture their youth. (Repeat).

programme.title: Divergent
programme.desc: In this inventive sci-fi film set in a society where the population is segregated by personality, a teenager classified as "divergent" uncovers a plot to kill everyone in her category and races to find out why they are considered so uniquely dangerous. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Divergent Series: Insurgent
programme.desc: In this thrilling and nail-biting entry in the Divergent series, Tris and Four seek refuge outside of the city with the Amity faction. They convene with other Divergents and exiled survivors, and plot to fight back against the warmongering Dauntless and despot Jeanine Matthews. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant
programme.desc: After discovering the truth about their walled city and breaking down its faction system, Tris and Four lead a journey out of Chicago to learn more about who has been manipulating their civilization in this thrilling entry in the YA adventure series. But once their group comes face-to-face with the society that turned their city into an enclosed experiment, secrets are uncovered that threaten the fate of humankind. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Dead Don't Hurt
programme.desc: In the 1860s western frontier, the fiercely independent Vivienne Le Coudy joins her lover Holger Olsen in Elk Flats, Nevada. But the Civil War tears them apart, leaving Vivienne to fight corrupt Mayor Schiller and his ruthless partner. When Holger returns, they must confront their changed selves amidst a landscape of love, betrayal, and the struggle for justice. (Repeat).

programme.title: Black Christmas
programme.desc: Katie Cassidy and Michelle Trachtenberg star in this terrifying update of a 1974 cult slasher flick about a psycho terrorizing a sorority house during the holiday season. Kristen Cloke, Crystal Lowe, Lacey Chabert. Directed by Glen Morgan. (Repeat).

programme.title: Noah
programme.desc: Noah receives a warning from God about a great flood, and constructs an ark to save creation as the planet is cleansed of sin in this stunning Biblical epic. Later, Noah and his family are forced to defend their massive vessel from malicious invaders. (Repeat).

programme.title: School of Rock
programme.desc: Jack Black earned a Golden Globe nomination for his inspired performance in Richard Linklater's whimsical comedy. He plays a manic slacker-turned-substitute teacher who transforms his sheltered private-school pupils into a full-fledged rock band. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Gift
programme.desc: In this nail-biting chiller, Simon and Robyn, a young married couple, find their lives thrown into a tailspin after Simon has a chance encounter with a former acquaintance, the off-kilter Gordo. Gordo then starts giving the couple unwanted and increasingly menacing gifts. (Repeat).

programme.title: Just Mercy
programme.desc: With huge opportunities laid down even before he graduated from Harvard Law School, Bryan Stevenson's career is shaping up to be an impressive one. He, however, decides to forgo all of those offers in order to go to Alabama and represent those who cannot afford a lawyer and those who are wrongly accused. There, he takes on the case of an African-American man wrongly imprisoned for the murder of a white woman. (Repeat).

programme.title: Heat
programme.desc: A successful career criminal considers getting out of the business after one last score with his crew, while an obsessive cop desperately tries to put him behind bars. The memorable "cafe scene" marks the first time Al Pacino and Robert De Niro have appeared on-screen together. (Repeat).

programme.title: Ezra
programme.desc: Max Bernal, a struggling stand-up comedian, faces the daunting challenge of co-parenting his autistic son, Ezra, with his ex-wife, Jenna. Living with his father, Max grapples with tough choices regarding Ezra's future. Together, father and son embark on a transformative cross-country journey that bonds them in unexpected ways. What follows is a heartfelt tale of family resilience, humor, and compassion. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Hurt Locker
programme.desc: Jeremy Renner heads the cast of this riveting Oscar-winning war drama about a trio of soldiers tasked with the nerve-racking job of dismantling improvised explosive devices in Baghdad. These three members of the Explosive Ordnance Disposal squad must put their fear and their personal beefs aside to keep themselves from going to "the hurt locker," the nickname soldiers have for where you recuperate after being injured in an explosion. Directed by Kathryn Bigelow. Guy Pearce, Ralph Fiennes. (Repeat).

programme.title: Goodfellas
programme.desc: Gangster saga explores the life of organized crime as it chronicles the true-life rise and fall of New York mobster and FBI informant Henry Hill and the more prominent "goodfellas" in his world. Henry comes up through the ranks, but quickly learns that his half-Irish, half-Sicilian ethnicity prevents him from ever becoming a "made guy." Soon he finds himself the target of both the feds and his Mafia family, who feel that he has become a threat to their security with his reckless dealings. (Repeat).

programme.title: Shooter
programme.desc: Mark Wahlberg gives a charged performance in this high-powered actioner about an ex-Marine sniper who is recruited for a clandestine special op and instead finds himself on the run after being targeted as the perpetrator of a presidential assassination attempt. Danny Glover, Kate Mara, Michael Pena, Tate Donovan, Ned Beatty, Rhona Mitra, Elias Koteas. Directed by Antoine Fuqua and written by Jonathan Lemkin, who adapted Stephen Hunter's book "Point of Impact." (Repeat).

programme.title: Eyes Wide Shut
programme.desc: Stanley Kubrick's final film is an erotic thriller about an affluent married couple who are plunged into a bizarre odyssey of sexual discovery, which leads to a dangerous realm of adulterous gamesmanship between the twosome. (Repeat).

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: Astronauts on the International Space Station retrieve a sample from Mars and discover it contains evidence of intelligent life in this sci-fi thriller. The specimen begins to show signs of aggression, threatening the entire mission. (Repeat).

programme.title: JFK Revisited: Through the Looking Glass
programme.desc: Oliver Stone reassesses John F. Kennedy's assassination 30 years after his first examination of the horrific event that shaped a generation. (Repeat).

programme.title: Jules
programme.desc: Jules follows Milton (Kingsley) who lives a quiet life of routine in a small western Pennsylvania town, but finds his day upended when a UFO and its extra-terrestrial passenger crash land in his backyard. Before long, Milton develops a close relationship with the extra-terrestrial he calls "Jules." Things become complicated when two neighbors (Harris and Curtin) discover Jules and the government quickly closes in. (Repeat).

programme.title: Just My Luck
programme.desc: Sizzling star Lindsay Lohan sparkles in this romantic comedy about a lucky career gal whose good fortunes are inexplicably reversed after she kisses the unluckiest guy in town at a masked ball. Chris Pine, Faizon Love, Missi Pyle. Directed by Donald Petrie. (Repeat).

programme.title: Little Black Book
programme.desc: Brittany Murphy is utterly charming in this winning comedy. She plays an insecure producer who raids her boyfriend's electronic organizer to find out about his romantic past. Unfortunately, she learns much more than she bargained for. Carly Simon contributed to the terrific soundtrack. Holly Hunter, Kathy Bates, Ron Livingston, Julianne Nicholson. (Repeat).

programme.title: Casino Royale
programme.desc: Daniel Craig kills in his first outing as British secret agent James Bond. In this gripping and ripping adaptation of Ian Fleming's first 007 adventure, Bond tries to turn the tables on a terrorist banker, whom he's engaged in a high-stakes poker game. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Boy
programme.desc: A woman acts as a nanny for a life-size doll, which a couple are using as a coping mechanism for the death of their son two decades earlier. However, she soon suspects that there is more to the doll than meets the eye in this disturbing horror film. (Repeat).

programme.title: True Grit
programme.desc: In the Coen brothers' stirring remake of the John Wayne classic, an alcoholic U.S. Marshal and an independent-minded 14-year-old girl track down her father's killer with the help of a Texas Ranger. As the three brave dangerous Indian territory, they discover their prey has fallen in with a more-experienced criminal. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Gambler
programme.desc: An English professor borrows money from a vicious gangster in an attempt to pay off his gambling debts in this poignant psychological drama. At the same time, he must contend with his disappointed mother and his affair with a precocious student. (Repeat).

programme.title: Casino Royale
programme.desc: Daniel Craig kills in his first outing as British secret agent James Bond. In this gripping and ripping adaptation of Ian Fleming's first 007 adventure, Bond tries to turn the tables on a terrorist banker, whom he's engaged in a high-stakes poker game. (Repeat).

programme.title: Get Rich Or Die Tryin'
programme.desc: Saga of a street kid turned drug dealer turned rap artist, loosely based on the life of hip-hop star Calvin "50 Cent" Jackson, who basically plays himself. (Repeat).

programme.title: Cabin Fever
programme.desc: In this chilling remake of the 2002 horror film of the same name, a group of friends head to a remote cabin in the woods for a vacation. However, their fun is soon interrupted by a flesh-eating virus that claims them one-by-one. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Inspection
programme.desc: Ellis French is a young, gay Black man, rejected by his mother and with few options for his future, decides to join the Marines, doing whatever it takes to succeed in a system that would cast him aside. But even as he battles deep-seated prejudice and the grueling routines of basic training, he finds unexpected camaraderie, strength, and support in this new community, giving him a hard-earned sense of belonging that will shape his identity and forever change his life. (Repeat).

programme.title: Paddington
programme.desc: After his home in Peru is destroyed, a talking bear named Paddington travels to London, where he is taken in by a kindly family. However, a museum taxidermist is determined to make a trophy out of him in this endearing adventure for all ages. (Repeat).

programme.title: Ernest Saves Christmas
programme.desc: Ernest scrambles to find a successor for Santa Claus in this Yuletide comedy. (Repeat).

programme.title: Free Birds
programme.desc: In this hilarious comedy for the entire family, two turkeys travel back in time to the first Thanksgiving in order to change the traditional menu and save their kind from being served with a side of cranberry sauce for the holiday. (Repeat).

programme.title: Runaway Jury
programme.desc: In this suspenseful, well-plotted and beautifully acted legal thriller, an attorney who's brought a wrongful-death lawsuit against a gun manufacturer, a jury consultant working for the company, and a member of the jury cross paths. The film is based on a John Grisham bestseller. (Repeat).

programme.title: Good Will Hunting
programme.desc: Costars and co-writers Matt Damon and Ben Affleck won an Oscar for their tale of a charismatic genius (Damon) who lands in jail after a playground brawl. His hope for the future lies with a sympathetic therapist (Best Supporting Actor Robin Williams), who understands the young man's rebellious nature. Minnie Driver, Stellan Skarsgard, Casey Affleck. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Lincoln Lawyer
programme.desc: In this pulse-pounding thriller, ethically challenged lawyer Mickey (Matthew McConaughey) lands a high-profile case defending a rich playboy accused of murder, but he soon discovers he'll need to keep his wits about him to get through the case alive. Directed by Brad Furman. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Dead Don't Hurt
programme.desc: In the 1860s western frontier, the fiercely independent Vivienne Le Coudy joins her lover Holger Olsen in Elk Flats, Nevada. But the Civil War tears them apart, leaving Vivienne to fight corrupt Mayor Schiller and his ruthless partner. When Holger returns, they must confront their changed selves amidst a landscape of love, betrayal, and the struggle for justice. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Italian Job
programme.desc: A breathtakingly paced remake of the 1969 caper film starring Michael Caine, with a gang of thieves out to retake some gold that was stolen from them after they pilfered it from a palazzo in Venice. The film features exciting chase scenes involving Mini Coopers racing through metropolitan Los Angeles. (Repeat).

programme.title: Downhill Racer
programme.desc: Robert Redford as an egotist skiing with the U.S. team in Europe. Fine skiing footage; filmed on location. Gene Hackman, Camilla Sparv, Jim McMullan. D.K.: Kenneth Kirk. Mayo: Dabney Coleman. Machet: Karl Michael Vogler. Tommy: Joe Jay Albert. Directed by Michael Ritchie. (Repeat).

programme.title: Pelé: Birth of a Legend
programme.desc: This electrifying biopic of Brazilian soccer star Pelé recounts his youth in the slums of São Paulo and his rapid ascension to the national team, where, at the age of just 17, he helped lead the squad to their first ever World Cup victory in 1958. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Brady Bunch Movie
programme.desc: A send-up of the TV series, it's the story of a lovely lady, a man named Brady, and their kids, whose wholesome '70s natures clashes with the grungy '90s. (Repeat).

programme.title: Paddington
programme.desc: After his home in Peru is destroyed, a talking bear named Paddington travels to London, where he is taken in by a kindly family. However, a museum taxidermist is determined to make a trophy out of him in this endearing adventure for all ages. (Repeat).

programme.title: Arthur and the Invisibles
programme.desc: With knowing nods to "The Wizard of Oz" and "Honey, I Shrunk the Kids," this wondrous blend of live action and stunning computer-animation is a blast. To save the family farm, a youngster (Freddie Highmore) shrinks in size to enter a magical world of wood sprites and search for treasure. Mia Farrow. Directed by Luc Besson, who co-wrote the script, which was based on two of his own Arthur best sellers. Among the voice talent are Madonna, Robert De Niro, Jimmy Fallon, David Bowie and Snoop Dogg. (Repeat).

programme.title: Free Birds
programme.desc: In this hilarious comedy for the entire family, two turkeys travel back in time to the first Thanksgiving in order to change the traditional menu and save their kind from being served with a side of cranberry sauce for the holiday. (Repeat).

programme.title: It Could Happen to You
programme.desc: A cop offers to share his lottery ticket with a waitress he can't afford to tip. He hits the jackpot and wins millions, but his girlfriend tries to convince him to welch on his promise to the waitress. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Age of Adaline
programme.desc: A beautiful woman stops aging after a car accident, and remains 29 for several decades in this intriguing fantasy. She refuses to get close to anyone in order to keep her condition a secret, but reconsiders her solitary lifestyle after falling in love with a philanthropist. (Repeat).

programme.title: Marcel: The Shell with Shoes On
programme.desc: The animated film follows the life of a young mollusk named Marcel as he discovers the world anew. When a documentary filmmaker shares an online snippet of Marcel, the shy shell goes viral. Soon, Marcel goes on a life-changing adventure to find his lost family. (Repeat).

programme.title: School of Rock
programme.desc: Jack Black earned a Golden Globe nomination for his inspired performance in Richard Linklater's whimsical comedy. He plays a manic slacker-turned-substitute teacher who transforms his sheltered private-school pupils into a full-fledged rock band. (Repeat).

programme.title: Wayne's World
programme.desc: Best friends Wayne and Garth are hired to host their public access show professionally. Wayne falls for Cassandra, the lead singer in a metal band, and must contend with a handsome network executive who plans to ruin their show and steal away Cassandra. Based on the iconic SNL skit. (Repeat).

programme.title: Hugo
programme.desc: In this wondrous fantasy film directed by Martin Scorsese, a young orphan named Hugo Cabret (Asa Butterfield) lives in a train station in 1930s Paris and tries to repair a mechanical man built by his father. Eventually, Hugo befriends a filmmaker and his goddaughter, who help him understand the mystery of his dad's invention. (Repeat).

programme.title: Free Birds
programme.desc: In this hilarious comedy for the entire family, two turkeys travel back in time to the first Thanksgiving in order to change the traditional menu and save their kind from being served with a side of cranberry sauce for the holiday. (Repeat).

programme.title: Home for the Holidays
programme.desc: A single woman, who is newly unemployed, dreads the annual Thanksgiving visit with her loving, but overbearing family. (Repeat).

programme.title: Get Over It
programme.desc: Kirsten Dunst stars in this charming teen romance about a guy (Ben Foster) who tries to win back his girlfriend by getting a part in the school play. With the help of a friend (Dunst), he hones his acting skills and discovers the meaning of true love. Sisqo, Martin Short, Melissa Sagemiller, Shane West, Colin Hanks, Mila Kunis. (Repeat).

programme.title: All Styles
programme.desc: A young hip-hop artist has a falling out with his dance crew over his decision to go to college before a big competition. (Repeat).

programme.title: Marcel: The Shell with Shoes On
programme.desc: The animated film follows the life of a young mollusk named Marcel as he discovers the world anew. When a documentary filmmaker shares an online snippet of Marcel, the shy shell goes viral. Soon, Marcel goes on a life-changing adventure to find his lost family. (Repeat).

programme.title: A Wonderful Time of the Year
programme.desc: The Marsh family is getting together for their first Christmas Eve after three years of pandemic lockdown. (Repeat).

programme.title: Mistletoe Ranch
programme.desc: Up-and-coming photographer Aimée strives to make it in the photography world. She finds herself squandering her talents as her demanding boss's assistant. A letter from her estranged family suddenly brings Aimée back to her rural childhood home, where she encounters more than she had ever hoped to expect amidst the holiday season. (Repeat).

programme.title: Deck the Halls
programme.desc: In this uproarious holiday farce, an uptight optometrist hits the roof when his neighbor decides to decorate his house with enough Christmas lights to be seen from space. (Repeat).

programme.title: Nine Lives
programme.desc: A businessman buys a cat as a gift for his daughter's birthday, only to have his mind transported into the feline's body following a car accident. As his family's new pet, he begins to see his loved ones in a different light in this delightful comedy. (Repeat).

programme.title: Blinded by the Light
programme.desc: A second-generation British-Pakistani teenager comes of age in a small town during the Thatcher era, rebelling against parental and cultural expectations and the confines of provincial life with the help of Bruce Springsteen's empowering music and relatable lyricism. (Repeat).

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: An urban teen moves to a rural Midwestern town where dancing is outlawed and fights to stage a high-school prom complete with dancing. He also falls for a local girl whose minister dad is behind the dirty dancing boycott. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Terminal
programme.desc: An Eastern European man is forced to live at JFK Airport after his visa is canceled due to a coup in his own country in this charming drama. In time, the terminal becomes a virtual country within itself, complete with culture, ambition, status, diversity and the need for love. (Repeat).

programme.title: While You Were Sleeping
programme.desc: A lonely turnstile clerk saves a man who has fallen onto the tracks, then poses as the comatose man's fiancée to gain access to his condition. (Repeat).

programme.title: Save the Last Dance
programme.desc: A suburban ballet student moves to Chicago, where she finds a new way to express herself in the hip-hop culture of her inner-city high school and explore a new romance in this upbeat teen drama. (Repeat).

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: An urban teen moves to a rural Midwestern town where dancing is outlawed and fights to stage a high-school prom complete with dancing. He also falls for a local girl whose minister dad is behind the dirty dancing boycott. (Repeat).

programme.title: Scrooged
programme.desc: A greedy TV executive learns the true meaning of Christmas in this updating of "A Christmas Carol". (Repeat).

programme.title: The Honeymooners
programme.desc: Big-screen take on the classic sitcom about a blustery, big-scheming New York City bus driver and his sewer-worker pal. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Christmas Classic
programme.desc: This holiday movie follows Elizabeth, a transplanted "city girl" type of career woman who returns to her hometown to buy a ski resort owned by her ex, Randy. She works for her fiancé's father, so Elizabeth wants to clinch the sale at his behest. Randy objects to being bought outright but proposes an alternative. If Elizabeth could win their town's annual Christmas-related competitions, he'd sell his property. The problem is, she needs to beat the long-running champion: her perfectionist sister. (Repeat).

programme.title: Spotlights: A Showtime Short Film Series
programme.desc: Maia sets out to reconnect with her Mexican-American roots on her Nana's birthday, but things go terribly wrong. (Repeat).

programme.title: Deck the Halls
programme.desc: In this uproarious holiday farce, an uptight optometrist hits the roof when his neighbor decides to decorate his house with enough Christmas lights to be seen from space. (Repeat).

programme.title: Clue
programme.desc: The whodunit board game comes to life as guests are invited to a swanky mansion to learn who is blackmailing them. (Repeat).

programme.title: Finding Neverland
programme.desc: Seven Oscar nominations, including Best Picture and Best Actor went to this magical portrait of Scottish playwright J.M. Barrie. The film chronicles his relationship with a young widow and her sons, which inspired "Peter Pan." (Repeat).

programme.title: Hugo
programme.desc: In this wondrous fantasy film directed by Martin Scorsese, a young orphan named Hugo Cabret (Asa Butterfield) lives in a train station in 1930s Paris and tries to repair a mechanical man built by his father. Eventually, Hugo befriends a filmmaker and his goddaughter, who help him understand the mystery of his dad's invention. (Repeat).

programme.title: Seabiscuit
programme.desc: A triumphant Cinderella story about the crowd-pleasing Depression-era thoroughbred Seabiscuit. Together, Seabiscuit's downtrodden jockey, wizened trainer and entrepreneurial owner lead the horse to several victories that helped to inspire a Americans during the downtrodden 1930s. (Repeat).

programme.title: Hearts Beat Loud
programme.desc: Widower and aging Brooklyn hipster Frank starts a band with his teenage daughter Sam just before she leaves home to attend college in California. When a song of theirs finds success online, it complicates Frank's attempts to let go of his dreams of stardom and allow his daughter to find her own path in life. (Repeat).

programme.title: Past Lives
programme.desc: Growing up in a small South Korean town, Hae Sung and Nora shared a deep, inextricable bond that was suddenly torn asunder by Nora's family's emigration to the United States. Twenty years later, the childhood sweethearts inexplicably cross paths and share one emotionally-charged week that forces them to confront long-dormant feelings and their hopes for the future. (Repeat).

programme.title: School of Rock
programme.desc: Jack Black earned a Golden Globe nomination for his inspired performance in Richard Linklater's whimsical comedy. He plays a manic slacker-turned-substitute teacher who transforms his sheltered private-school pupils into a full-fledged rock band. (Repeat).

programme.title: Bad News Bears
programme.desc: A cynical, hard-drinking ex-baseball player (Billy Bob Thornton) grudgingly coaches an inept Little League team in this hit-and-miss remake of the 1976 classic. Greg Kinnear, Marcia Gay Harden. Directed by Richard Linklater ("School of Rock"). (Repeat).

programme.title: Down to You
programme.desc: A cooking student begins a relationship with an ambitious freshman that starts well, but eventually hits a rough patch due to various forces that press upon any college student. (Repeat).

programme.title: Poppy
programme.desc: Nineteen-year-old Poppy Simpson refuses to be defined by Down syndrome and is determined to take charge of her own life. (Repeat).

programme.title: Bad News Bears

programme.title: Warrior Strong
programme.desc: To save the career he endangered with his hotheaded attitude, professional basketball player Bilal Irving takes on a new job - coaching the failing basketball team in his hometown of Dumont, Ontario. He's got just one obstacle: his former coach, whose ideas about coaching vastly differ from that of Bilal's. The two will have to put aside their differences and their attitudes if this small-town team is to have any chance at winning. (Repeat).

programme.title: Nine Lives
programme.desc: A businessman buys a cat as a gift for his daughter's birthday, only to have his mind transported into the feline's body following a car accident. As his family's new pet, he begins to see his loved ones in a different light in this delightful comedy. (Repeat).

programme.title: My Fair Lady
programme.desc: This Best Picture, a musical reworking of George Bernard Shaw's "Pygmalion," is about a pompous, acid-tongued professor of linguistics (Best Actor Rex Harrison) who tries to refine an ill-mannered, uneducated guttersnipe and pass her off as a princess in six months. The film won a total of eight Oscars. (Repeat).

programme.title: Save the Last Dance
programme.desc: A suburban ballet student moves to Chicago, where she finds a new way to express herself in the hip-hop culture of her inner-city high school and explore a new romance in this upbeat teen drama. (Repeat).

programme.title: There's Something About Mary
programme.desc: From the Farrelly brothers comes a hilarious, over-the-top comedy about a journalist (Ben Stiller) who hires a sleazy private eye (Matt Dillon) to track down his high-school prom date (Cameron Diaz). You'll never look at hair gel in the same way again. Chris Elliott, Lin Shaye, Lee Evans, W. Earl Brown, Markie Post, Brett Favre.

programme.title: Fat Joe Talks
programme.desc: (Repeat).

programme.title: Beyond the Lights
programme.desc: Romance ignites between a troubled young singer on the cusp of stardom and a handsome police officer with political ambitions in this captivating love story. When Noni attempts suicide, concerned cop Kaz pulls her back from the ledge and shows her that life is still worth living. However, the powers that be conspire to keep them apart.

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Afterlife
programme.desc: Single mother Callie seeks a fresh start with her two children, moving her family to a rural midwestern town. Yet they soon experience a host of supernatural circumstances, unveiling a strange connection to the children's eccentric grandfather. Based on the 1984 cult classic film.

programme.title: Pandorum
programme.desc: Terror runs deeper than flesh when astronauts Lt. Payton (Dennis Quaid) and Cpl. Bower (Ben Foster) awaken from hypersleep to find that the 60,000 passengers aboard their spacecraft have vanished, and the fate of mankind now rests in their hands.

programme.title: A Thousand and One
programme.desc: The foster care system can be punishing for children, especially when they are living in a hostile situation. Inez commits a necessary crime and kidnaps a six-year-old boy named Terry. The new mother and son duo now live in New York City, and Inez needs to protect her child at all costs.

programme.title: Fat Joe Talks
programme.desc: (Repeat).

programme.title: Outlander
programme.desc: Jamie, Claire, and Ian return to Lallybroch. Ian reconnects with his family in a time of need, while Claire deals with the fallout from a long-held secret. Roger and Buck search for Jemmy in the past. (Repeat).

programme.desc: A green cop unwittingly records the death of a drug dealer with her body camera. Reviewing the footage, she realizes that the death was no accident. programme.desc: When Bennie's daughter comes home for Christmas, she brings a surprise gringo boyfriend with her. Bennie is a traditional Mexican who is taken aback by his daughter's choice of partner and is having a hard time accepting him. This Christmas, he must learn to grow or risk losing the trust of his family.

programme.title: Escape Room: Tournament of Champions
programme.desc: The original escape room game scenario team's survivors, Zoey and Ben, meet up in the present to face another round orchestrated by the Gamemaster as they are joined by a new set of teammates composed of diverse individuals. However, the original group's members died one by one inside different escape rooms as the team progressed into the game. Zoey and Ben try to figure things out so as not to repeat the same tragedy.

programme.title: Champions
programme.desc: Contending with misdemeanor charges, disgraced minor league basketball coach Marcus receives orders from the court to take a team of players with intellectual disabilities under his wing. Longing for the skills of his former team, Marcus initially struggles to connect with his new team, given the variety of challenges their diagnoses present. Yet the athletes' continued perseverance against the odds inspires Marcus to change his ways, in turn helping the team reach new heights.

programme.desc: After three years of dating, Omar still has no idea how to keep his girlfriend Diane happy. Three days, a washing machine, and sundry spare parts later, he's invented Charles, an artificially intelligent robot who learns English from a dictionary and proves a charming, cheeky companion. Before long, however, Charles also develops autonomy.

programme.title: Trauma: Life in the E.R.
programme.desc: Medical emergencies at Baylor University Medical Center in Dallas include a rodeo champ trampled by a bull; a man whose house collapsed on him; a motor-scooter accident victim with internal bleeding; a 3-year-old with seizures. (Repeat).

programme.title: Trauma: Life in the E.R.
programme.desc: Cases at Legacy Emanuel Hospital in Portland include an elderly man with lung damage from smoking; a patient experiencing numbness; a toddler with a massive eye infection; and a mother and child who were hit by a car. (Repeat).

programme.title: Trauma: Life in the E.R.
programme.desc: The staff at Legacy Emanuel Hospital in Portland, Ore., treats recreational activity-related accident victims, including a snowmobiler who went off a cliff, and a boy injured by a log in the surf. Also: the role of the anesthesiologist is highlighted. (Repeat).

programme.title: Trauma: Life in the E.R.
programme.desc: Oklahoma is a land of heroes past and present. "Never say never" is a motto that describes its citizens, as well as the medical staff at the University of Oklahoma Trauma Center, who never say "never," even to the most severely injured patients. Among those in need of care are a man who fell off his motorcycle at 75 mph and requires a triple amputation, a woman who fell into a sewer hole, and a patient who was pinned under his tractor for several hours. (Repeat).

programme.title: Trauma: Life in the E.R.
programme.desc: The Level One trauma center of San Francisco General Hospital is observed. Included: a drug addict infected with flesh-eating bacteria; a man on drugs who tried to direct traffic; a man with a high blood-alcohol level who was stabbed. (Repeat).

programme.title: My 600-lb Life
programme.desc: A 660-lb. man's weight-loss journey is motivated by love. (Repeat).

programme.title: My 600-lb Life

programme.title: My 600-lb Life

programme.desc: Krystal S. has finally met the man of her dreams, but she won't let herself marry him until she can be sure that she won't become bedridden and force him into the role of caretaker. (Repeat).

programme.desc: Karina's weight has placed a burden on her parents and driven a wedge between her and her sister. (Repeat).

programme.desc: Tamy faces a dilemma after her husband gives her an ultimatum of moving away from Houston; Karina is dating someone that Dr. Now knows. (Repeat).

programme.title: My 600-lb Life
programme.desc: Growing up in foster care, David suffered from a lack of attention and didn't develop a sense of self-worth. Now he weighs 800 pounds, and he's relying on his favorite foster mom to support him as he finds the motivation to change and save his own life. (Repeat).

programme.title: My 600-lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: After getting his surgery canceled and living in his van by the beach, surgery might be the break David has been waiting for his whole life. Syreeta suffers a devastating personal tragedy that only strengthens her desire to become a mother. (Repeat).

programme.title: My 600-lb Life

programme.desc: A Hollywood hooker signs on for a weeklong job with a john who is a corporate raider; he pays for a makeover so she can act as his "date." (Repeat).

programme.title: The Women
programme.desc: Polished and incisive remake of the 1939 classic about a sisterhood of well-to-do New Yorkers who rally around their friend (Meg Ryan) when they learn her husband is having an affair. programme.title: Silicon Valley

programme.title: Silicon Valley

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Richard's neuroses could ruin his new relationship; Big Head and Erlich's launch party goes awry; Dinesh is smitten with a foreign coworker. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: A beta version of Pied Piper gets an unexpected reception as Dinesh's lack of friends worries him, but Gilfoyle thinks he's stretching the truth. Meanwhile, Amanda isn't sure she can dole out criticism; a strapped Erlich mulls a big decision; and the Nucleus team tackles a difficult challenge from Gavin. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Erlich tries to be honest with Richard, who has mixed emotions about their friendship and the future of Pied Piper. Meanwhile, Jared's new company apparel turns heads but fuels yet another clash between Dinesh and Gilfoyle. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Shocking stats are revealed and prompt Richard to bridge the gap between Pied Piper and its users, but Jared must go to extremes to keep everything intact. Meanwhile, Gavin tries to recapture his former glory by bringing in new talent after discovering secrets about the competition. (Repeat).

programme.desc: In the Season 3 finale, Pied Piper's future is hazy, but Erlich's industry profile begins to rise, creating a moral dilemma for Richard as Dinesh's new app starts to catch on. programme.desc: Laughs mix with gasps in this compelling story about a milquetoast physics professor (Michael Stuhlbarg) who finds his life unraveling as he deals with his cheating wife, threats to his tenure and a neighbor who likes to sunbathe naked. (Repeat).

programme.title: Dinner for Schmucks
programme.desc: In this riotous comedy, Tim wants to snag a big promotion at work, but to do so he must take an eccentric nutcase to his boss's dinner party, where guests are supposed to bring the strangest person they can find. (Repeat).

programme.desc: The narrative follows a very unkempt professor named Paul Matthews. His life is quite uneventful until suddenly, his image appears in people's dreams. However, things change when these dreams soon become nightmares for some and, later, for many. (Repeat).

programme.title: Clear History
programme.desc: A marketing executive at an electric-car start-up quits after an argument with his boss, but is crushed when the company hits the big time, so he tries to reinvent his life under a different name in the peace and quiet of Martha's Vineyard. (Repeat).

programme.title: America's Sweethearts

Julia Roberts also stars as the actress's sister, who secretly loves brother-in-law Cusack. Billy Crystal, Christopher Walken, Hank Azaria, Stanley Tucci. (Repeat).

programme.title: Mamma Mia!

(Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: In the Season 4 premiere, the guys struggle to find funding for Pied Piper's video-chat app to keep up with their rapidly growing user base. programme.title: Silicon Valley

(Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Jared worries about Richard when he reaches out to an unlikely ally; Gilfoyle gets serious about security after Dinesh's latest dalliance; Erlich grows concerned about Jian-Yang's commitment to his app. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Richard's latest partnership begins to crumble when he has to deal with an unexpected interloper. Meanwhile, Dinesh looks for a way out of his new relationship; and Monica faces a business dilemma after learning of surprising developments at Raviga. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: A hunt for financial support takes Richard outside the tech bubble, where he encounters a contentious figure from Pied Piper's past. Meanwhile, Erlich contacts Monica and Laurie about a new endeavor; and Jared plays peacemaker between Dinesh and Gilfoyle after a launch goes awry. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Richard decides to stand up to a patent troll, but his defiance comes back to haunt him; Gilfoyle goes to extremes to battle Jian-Yang's new smart fridge; Jared embraces multiple identities in an effort to reduce costs; Erlich mixes with a group of alpha males. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Richard ponders a deal with the tech world's latest "it" boy; Jack faces setbacks. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Erlich goes on a trip to get his mojo back while the guys head to Hooli-Con, where Jared faces a moral dilemma; Gilfoyle and Dinesh are distracted by Keenan; and Richard becomes obsessed with an ex's new beau. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: In the Season 4 finale, Richard's caught in a web of lies in a last-ditch attempt to save Pied Piper. Meanwhile, Jared plans his exit when he's worried about Richard's future; Jack tries to change the narrative; and Gavin plots his comeback. (Repeat).

She plays Bridget, a London "singleton" desperate to lose weight, cut down on her vices and find Mr. Right. The film chronicles her romantic entanglements with two gents: her playboy boss (Hugh Grant) and a snooty lawyer (Colin Firth). Jim Broadbent, Gemma Jones. (Repeat).

Living in New York City has been tough as his career as a toy creator has not gone to plan. At the eleventh hour, he finds a unique artist who may become his sponsor—as long as he helps her with her next exhibition. (Repeat).

programme.title: Pretty Woman
programme.desc: A Hollywood hooker signs on for a weeklong job with a john who is a corporate raider; he pays for a makeover so she can act as his "date." (Repeat).

programme.desc: In this hysterical big-screen continuation of the popular British sitcom, hard-living ladies Edina and Patsy flee to the French Riviera after they accidentally cause the death of a celebrity at a posh party. (Repeat).

programme.title: Arthur
programme.desc: In this hysterical comedy, playboy man-child Arthur (Russell Brand) learns that his wealthy mother will only give him his inheritance if he agrees to marry the daughter of a self-made millionaire. However, Arthur hates his intended bride and instead falls for an unlicensed tour guide. (Repeat).

programme.title: Tyler Perry's Meet the Browns
programme.desc: Writer-director Tyler Perry's fourth film is an uproarious, insightful comedy about a hard-luck single mom (Angela Bassett) from Chicago who attends her long-estranged father's funeral in rural Georgia and meets a clan of offbeat relatives she didn't know she had. Former NBA star Rick Fox costars as a college hoops coach who is romantically interested in Bassett. Perry costars as Joe and has a cameo as his recurring character, the larger-than-life matriarch, Madea. (Repeat).

Using recovered extraterrestrial technology, the alliance readies itself for a massive war. (Repeat).

Dejected and without direction now that his dreams have been dashed, Jaime finds an ancient scarab that turns out to be an alien symbiote. When the scarab chooses him, Jaime becomes the third incarnation of the superhero, The Blue Beetle. This film is a superhero movie based on the DC comic of the same name. (Repeat).

programme.title: Tyler Perry's The Family That Preys
programme.desc: Tyler Perry wrote, directed, produced and costars in this gripping drama about a scandal that rocks two families with a lengthy history. One of them is upper-class, the other working class, and each is led by a strong-willed matriarch who are long-time friends. Kathy Bates and Alfre Woodard are outstanding as the two women trying to keep their respective families from ruining countless lives. The superb ensemble cast also features Sanaa Lathan, Cole Hauser, Rockmond Dunbar and Kadee Strickland. (Repeat).

Meanwhile, Dinesh and Gilfoyle question their ability to make decisions; and Gavin returns to Hooli, but worried about becoming antiquated. (Repeat).

programme.desc: Richard's in over his head when he finds himself leading a much larger team and managing a number of small conflicts among his employees. programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Encouraged by Jared to strike up a friendship with Dana, a like-minded CEO, Richard instead finds himself charmed by Dana's COO, who challenges his loyalty to Gilfoyle. Facing limited housing options thanks to his impulse purchase, Dinesh searches for a new roommate. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Attempting to woo a gaming company to PiperNet, Richard inadvertently angers a prized ally; Dinesh deals with a betrayal; in preparation for a big launch, Gavin leaves his underlings with a cryptic message; Jared gets inside information from Big Head. (Repeat).

programme.desc: Overshadowed by Jared in an on-camera interview, Richard's confidence wavers further when Laurie and Monica force him to work with Eklow, a new artificial-intelligence company. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Richard decides to help when Laurie gets in a jam, but his lack of emotional discipline threatens to backfire on Pied Piper; Gavin tries to make a deal with a stubborn partner while abroad; Dinesh relishes a rare win; Jared bonds with a surprising figure. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Richard gets unsettling news as the Pied Piper guys prepare to close their Series B funding. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley

programme.desc: Polished and incisive remake of the 1939 classic about a sisterhood of well-to-do New Yorkers who rally around their friend (Meg Ryan) when they learn her husband is having an affair. programme.desc: Two hard-partying ladies see a viral video in which unruly brothers plead for dates for their sister's wedding in Hawaii, and decide to pose as the angels they're looking for in order to score a free trip in this incredibly raunchy comedy. (Repeat).

programme.desc: The Flash sequel follows Barry Allen on time-bending adventures that alter the course of history. He soon discovers that his mission leads to the creation of a multiverse where General Zod is on the rise and there are no superheroes to fight him. Allen must navigate the multiverse to find Batman and convince him to save the world. (Repeat).

programme.desc: A major event puts PiperNet's capabilities to the test; Monica confronts Jian-Yang over his use of Pied Piper's name. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: In the series finale, Richard and the Pied Piper team look to pull off a spectacular feat on the day of a big launch. (Repeat).

programme.title: Wonka
programme.desc: This fantasy musical film follows the story of Willy Wonka, the famous but eccentric chocolatier based on the character from Roald Dahl's novel. In particular, it emphasizes his rise to the top. The narrative traces his beginnings as a young adult who started as an employee selling chocolate in a store until he became driven to enter the chocolate industry eventually. This film acts as a prequel to the 1971 film adaptation of Dahl's novel. (Repeat).

The dark and visually stunning adventure was directed by Zack Snyder, who deemed his film version "a separate artistic experience from the book." (Repeat).

programme.desc: A womanizer is haunted by his many old flames while attending his brother's wedding in this rollicking romantic comedy starring Matthew McConaughey. Having conquered almost the entire bridal party, libidinous celebrity photographer Connor Mead ponders bedding the bride's mother until the Ghosts of Girlfriends Past guide him on an eye-opening tour of his romantic past, present and future. Hilarity blends with heartache as they attempt to discern whether Connor will ever be able to mend his ways. (Repeat).

programme.title: 21 and Over
programme.desc: A gifted medical student puts his education in jeopardy when he decides to celebrate his 21st birthday with two rowdy pals the night before a crucial exam in this sidesplitting comedy. (Repeat).
